fields.description:
We've had a case where a 61M changeset is being rendered to the browser. This results in a 500 error as the request takes longer than 30 seconds to render.

This should not occur and instead the changeset should be flagged as too big to render.
fields.summary: DiffTooBig check for changesets is not working (BB-4017)

fields.description: If you have a single directory with a lot of files in it, it can take a while to load. We should consider paginating it.
fields.summary: Paginate source lists (BB-4016)

fields.description:
Not solved by existing (resolved) issues (e.g. BCLOUD-3387)

Our repository contains git submodules and the issue seems to pop up when the commit also contains an update of the submodule.
fields.summary: "File contents unchanged" while the raw commit has changes (BB-5076)

fields.description:
For [[https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issues|TortoiseHg]] there are several issues containing the words "TypeError" and "NoneType" (like [[https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issue/1838/|thg BCLOUD-1838]]), yet the search for both words (separated by a space) give in no results:

https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issues?q=TypeError+NoneType

This occurs if you have one key word in either the title or the description but not both.

This is quite bad as this leads to a [[https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issue/1617/crash-when-going-to-settings-on-new|lot of duplicate issues]] and therefore unnecessary work for the developers.
fields.summary: Issue search not working properly (BB-4021)

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm having problems pushing some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:shivha/ice-framework.git'. The updates are working fine. My guess is the permissions issue on the server's repository side.

Thanks in advance.

P.S :  By the way, You are doing a good job fellows. Keep up ;-)
fields.summary: Repository's permission issue

fields.description:
The line suggesting the command line for updating a fork, needs a carriage return. In the example below, the "hg update default" statement is on the same line as the "hg pull ..." statement. This confused me for a moment.

$ hg pull -r default https://ArcoOost@bitbucket.org/ArcoOost/expanders$ hg update default\\
$ hg merge 83586d1c760e

Regards,\\
Arco Oost
fields.summary: Information on incoming changes in fork

fields.description:
Clicking on this one:\\
https://bitbucket.org/sguandalini/rfapplet\\
results in an error.\\
Could you please check?
fields.summary: Repo broken

fields.description:
Sometimes, a pull request is so large that it takes longer than 30 seconds to fulfill.

Currently, after 30 seconds we stop the request and thus don't allow a user to fulfill a request at all. If we do this asynchronously we won't have this problem.
fields.summary: Fulfill Pull requests asynchronously (BB-4011)

fields.description:
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: rcorbett\\
pushing to https://rcorbett@bitbucket.org/rcorbett/its\\
searching for changes\\
HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error
fields.summary: Getting 500 Internal Server Error

fields.description: I can see the files that were changed in each commit, but not the actual diff. Just white space where the diff should be.
fields.summary: Diff does not work on Android (BB-4012)
same page TOC links have wrong URLs (BB-4018)

fields.description:
Hello, whenever I run hg clone, after a while i get the following message:  abort: stream ended unexpectedly (got xxxxx bytes, expected xxxxxxxxx)

I tried this several times without success.  Is there a cap or limit as to how much data can be download from a repository in one session?  I'm not sure what else I can try.

Thanks for the help!
fields.summary: hg clone always fails

fields.description:
In order to delete a comment you need to:

h1. Click Spam
h1. Refresh the page (this is a bug)
h1. Click Delete
This is not very intuitive.
fields.summary: Delete comment is confusing (BB-3996)

fields.description: The broker itself is here https://bitbucket.org/shiningpanda/shiningpanda-bitbucket-broker/src/660f2cd739fe/shiningpanda.py and its tests are in integration here https://jenkins.shiningpanda.com/shiningpanda.org/job/shiningpanda-bitbucket-broker.
fields.summary: Integrate Shining Panda Broker (BB-3987)

fields.description:
If I push to multiple branches of a single git repository, bitbucket shows all the commits in a single 'activity' message which makes it pretty unclear which branch they apply to.

It would be great if the activity messages could list the branch they apply to; and possibly be grouped by the branch as well.
fields.summary: Activity: show relevant branch (BB-3997)

fields.description: I've recently removed a small branch from my git repository, and bitbucket lists it in my activity as having 'stripped' a number of commits. I think it would be better if bitbucket could merge strips into a single message/list like it does with commit messages.
fields.summary: Activity: merge multiple 'stripped' commits (BB-3994)

fields.description: Would make sense to allow attaching an issue to a commit. Would majorly add to the utility of the issue tracker. And even better to add issue tracker features to SourceTree!
fields.summary: Connect issues to commits

fields.description: The build query function is very nice, however I hardly use it because I have to re-build my queries every time. It would be great to be able to save them and they would line up between the [ All | Open | My issues ] and [ Build Query ] buttons!
fields.summary: Allow to save built queries

fields.description:
Getting an error when trying to access this repository:

https://bitbucket.org/rmadden/tireswing-helpdesk-rollup

I don't need the repo and it can be purged.
fields.summary: Oops, an error occurred!

fields.description:
When reviewing a pull request the "Incoming commits" table crops individual commit messages, often masking important information. This is especially true if the commit has multiple branch tags. Whilst it's certainly possible to browse into each commit to read the full message, it would enhance productivity if the whole message could be read form the pull requests page.

Please see https://bitbucket.org/ziadev/alfresco-mobile/pull-request/36/fixes-for-mobile-216-217-218 for an example.

Thanks,\\
Mike
fields.summary: UX improvement: Commit messages in pull request (BB-3995)

fields.description: I am admin in a repository and I cannot delete any comment, not even my own.
fields.summary: I cannot delete comments in the tracker

fields.description: I know it doesn't make any sense to click on it... But I get a 404 - Not found.
fields.summary: Click on diff when there is no history (BB-3112)

fields.description:
My newsfeed (start page) is less readable due to the\\
{{{\\
git-svn-id: https://...\\
}}}\\
tag attached at the end of each commit message
fields.summary: Strip git-svn-id tag in the Newsfeed

fields.description: It would be good if instead of having an overall formatting set to the repository to have it based on the filename like .c .cpp .html .css.
fields.summary: Formatting based on filename

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add some UNIX/Linux shell scripting languages to the programming language list?\\
In particular, I would be interested in bash [1] and zsh [2].

1: https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/

2: http://zsh.sourceforge.net/
fields.summary: Add some UNIX/Linux shell scripting languages

fields.description:
after adding a page in the wiki it cant be found. there is not link to it from the wiki page.\\
only way to see it is in the dashboard where there is a message:\\
"created wiki-page xxx in xxx".\\
there is no link from the wiki page.\\
plus i cant find where i can delete a wiki page.

thanks,\\
yossi.
fields.summary: adding a page in the wiki
Just wanted to say you are awesome !
help link on 404 pages links to the user page for user "help" (BB-3988)

fields.description:
I logged in today, and had seen that our repositories were over their user limit.  To remedy the situation I removed individual users from a group, then deleted the group itself.

This had no effect.  After which, I clicked on the "Resolve this" link located above.  This sent me to the account page where I can remove individual users.  However, after clicking on red icon next to the user names, I agreed to the popup box that appeared.  No changes were made.\\
I opened up firebug and I received the following message:\\
"NetworkError: 404 NOT FOUND - https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/group-privileges/gmdc/wuweisolutions/wu-wei-solutions/?private=true"

Thank-You for your help.
fields.summary: User Removal not functioning

fields.description:
Looking at this changeset on Mozilla Firefox 10.0.2 on Ubuntu Natty, I get a very corrupted and basically unreadable view.  I've attached a couple of screenshots of the main view, but the side-by-side view is no better.

I've also tried this on Google Chrome and it's much the same.

https://bitbucket.org/abudden/taghighlight/changeset/4f1c65b0328b
fields.summary: Changeset view is corrupted and unreadable (BB-4118)

fields.description: I could add "project logo" from "admin" tab of the project repository, but can not remove once I've added an image. How do I remove it ?
fields.summary: Can add but can't remove "project logo"

fields.description:
This setting is a lot useful to focus on what you have to do.

So i recommend an enhancement! Instead of show "all issues" as landing page, what about to show only the open issues?

i think it's simple to do and it permits to gain more focus to what is still missing!

thank you!.
fields.summary: Issues as repo's landing page (BB-3981)

fields.description:
When changing the name of a repo, or adding new users to a repo, the repo page for the user does not reflect the changes as quickly as desired.

I believe you are caching the content of this page for a long duration.
fields.summary: User dashboard does not reflect repo changes immediately

fields.description:
If you look at the recent commits on https://bitbucket.org/vinay.sajip/pylauncher/, you'll see that changes to launcher.rst are not correctly shown. It only shows the first few lines of the file, even though there are changes throughout the file.

Example:

https://bitbucket.org/vinay.sajip/pylauncher/changeset/e73603fa89af#chg-Doc/launcher.rst

If you examine the changes in a CLI, you'll see that there are more than show up in the UI.
fields.summary: diff UI not working properly for .rst files (BB-4088)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
I've created a repo called "cls", but each time I'm trying to access it (on the dashboard) I'm getting a user friendly error that does not tell me anything about the actual error. And since I can't access it, I can't delete it either, so this i skind of strange.\\
Can it be because of the 3 letters name? Or did I hit some hard-coded strings into the bitbucket project? :-)

Best regards,\\
Ion
fields.summary: Cannot access repo

fields.description:
It is very usefull workflow to create menu wiki page with links to nonexisting sub pages and after click on this links to create subpages.

On your hosting nonexisting links are not colored and click to link shows 404 page.

Can you fix it?
fields.summary: IntraWiki link to nonexisting page doesn't work (BB-4035)

fields.description:
It seems that ssh tunneling feature does not work for hg.\\
It worked good in few month ago.
fields.summary: ssh tunneling does not work

fields.description:
I've deleted the repository called babycarrot and it still exists in my account. I can neither remove or browse it. It looks like some bugs.\\
https://bitbucket.org/ryanicle/babycarrot/overview

Thanks.
fields.summary: Old repository still exists

fields.description: Some projects use tags to mark releases. It would be great if bitbucket provided a feed for project tags, allowing users to track such releases easily.
fields.summary: RSS/Atom feed for project tags (BB-3974)

fields.description:
Great site. And I mean GREAT! Just importing a bunch of git repositories.  The email subject I get on jobs completed could be improved by mentioning the repository in the subject: 'Your git import job for "Secret project" has finished', or such.

Again, great job.
fields.summary: Better import completion email (BB-3973)

fields.description: Like the main repo page, when adding/changing a user alias, the page should update to show the user link and picture for that given commiter, but the newfeed doesn't update but continues to provide invalid user urls.
fields.summary: News feed doesn't update after alias change (BB-3972)

fields.description:
I have stripped a changeset from the following repository and then I got the following message:\\
Repository unavailable

This repository is currently being stripped. Please wait for a moment and then refresh this page or go to repository overview.

https://bitbucket.org/casebuilders/testcase/admin/strip

Please help

Kind regards
fields.summary: Repository unavailable after strip command from admin interface

fields.description: I completed a task called pet happiness and got the bar at the top that kept track of how many treats I had and now it's gone and there are tasks I can't complete because I can't figure out how to get it back because the game won't let me go back and redo the pet happiness task. Can anyone help???
fields.summary: Pet shop game

fields.description:
I'm trying to set up a Hudson CI server locally that is supposed clone my repository (as CI servers do)

I specified username and password in the repository URI, e.g:

hg clone https://uwe_pachler:********@www.bitbucket.org/uwe_pachler/MyRepos

The output I'm getting when I run hg with the --debug option is this:

using https://www.bitbucket.org/uwe_pachler/MyRepos/\\
http auth: user uwe_pachler, password ********\\
sending capabilities command\\
www.bitbucket.org certificate successfully verified\\
bitbucket.org certificate successfully verified\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: <--- prompt\\
password: <----prompt

I'm not sure if this is a bug or config issue in bitbucket, or maybe some problem with Mercurial; however, all docs on the web suggest that specifying passwords on the URI should work...\\
Also, the client reports it did find a password, but it still keeps asking again...

Cheers,

Uwe
fields.summary: Mercurial requires password even if already given in repository URI

fields.description:
I changed my username from AdamKG to adamkg in order to try the static hosting, however, I can't seem to push anymore:

{{{\\
$ hg outgoing\\
comparing with ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/adamkg/adamkg.bitbucket.org\\
searching for changes\\
changeset:   0:1add986ec066\\
tag:         tip\\
user:        Adam Gomaa [adam%40gomaa.us]\\
date:        Mon Apr 09 05:31:58 2012 -0400\\
summary:     test initial commit\\
$ hg push -v\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/adamkg/adamkg.bitbucket.org\\
running ssh hg@bitbucket.org "hg -R adamkg/adamkg.bitbucket.org serve --stdio"\\
searching for changes\\
1 changesets found\\
remote: adding changesets\\
remote: adding manifests\\
remote: adding file changes\\
remote: added 1 changesets with 36 changes to 36 files\\
remote: Can't find your username.\\
remote: transaction abort!\\
remote: rollback completed\\
remote: abort: pretxnchangegroup.bb_perm hook failed\\
}}}

Per\\
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/412/ability-to-change-username-with-openid#comment-6360 I removed & re-added my SSH key, but it didn't change anything.
fields.summary: Can't push after changing username

fields.description:
My newsfeed is spammed by bots that are following every bitbucket repo. Some of them:

* https://bitbucket.org/ericar70
* https://bitbucket.org/mariab70
* https://bitbucket.org/richs70
* https://bitbucket.org/steven80
* https://bitbucket.org/peterh80

etc. Is it possible to have some kind of protection against this? This is an issue because newsfeed is limited and I can miss important past updates because the newsfeed is occupied by bots.
fields.summary: Follow spam

fields.description:
If I'm viewing a commit, where I see the differences, but I want to see the entire file at that commit. I have to now go to the source, and then go to that revision and see it.\\
Can you please provide a link on the commit page to see the full source of the file?
fields.summary: Go to source from a commit

fields.description: My account shows three private users when I go to "Plans and Billing" but there is no one other than me with access to any of my private repositories.
fields.summary: Wrong number of private users in my account

fields.description: Hi, I get the following message when I try to upload a file in the Downloads tab. I've attached the file for reference. This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below. {{{\\ #!xml AccessDenied Invalid according to Policy: Policy Condition failed: ["eq", "$success_action_redirect", "http://hg.dspherestudios.com/DSS_Preacher/dss-revive/downloads/add"] C27B9A28116CA70D epGMM8E6dhIK+H7G7yNihI4NqqOm33IucclO+0xHK/LafAo1f+laPlCbm1wE00mE }}}
fields.summary: Unable to upload file

fields.description:
Viewing diffs/commits for text files that have changes on very long lines (such as TeX that isn't hard-wrapped) is cumbersome without line wrapping.

It would be helpful if there was an option to toggle line wrapping for the commit and side-by-side diff views.
fields.summary: Wrap long source lines when viewing commits/side-by-side diff

fields.description:
When you are editing a wiki page, if you press back on your browser, you lose all you've been writing without a single warning (like I suffered today after half an hour of writing down ideas)

Use the browser "You're about to lose changes" warning to avoid this happening.
fields.summary: Warn when leaving page and still editing (BB-3929)

fields.description:
I'm very new to git and bitbucket, so I may be doing this wrong, but I'll go ahead and post my steps:

# forked and empty repo
# cloned the fork to a local repo
# committed initial code base to local repo
# pushed commit
# clicked "create pull request"  -- this is where I get the following error: Oops! An error occurred.\\
We've been notified and we'll look into the problem.

Is this something I'm doing wrong or a genuine bug?
fields.summary: Cannot create pull request against an empty repo (BB-3749)

fields.description:
In the issue list, there is plenty of space to put more useful information like:

* Comments count
* Last user to comment
* Date/time of last comment
* Issue type (instead of or next to symbol)
fields.summary: Improvements in issue list (BB-8032)

fields.description: Dans les profondeurs rochenoires, quand on possède la clé ombreforge on peut activer un mécanisme qui permet de fermer les grandes portes dévoilant ainsi un passage vers la garnison de l'ouest. Ce mécanisme ne fonctionne pas, on peut l'activer mais les portes ne bougent pas.
fields.summary: Accès Garnison de l'ouest

fields.description: I am having an issue with all of my repositories. Anytime I accept a pull request, I am getting an error stating, "Please correct the error below - Conflicts during merge". When I pull to my local repository to handle the merge conflict, none exists. Some of the repositories have had only a single person working, and their local copies are updated. This is preventing my team and myself from checking in changes. Any help would be appreciated.
fields.summary: Merge issues on every repository
Every time I fork a repo, I get an "Oops an error occured" page, but it seems to work fine otherwise... (BB-3922)

fields.description: I trying to switch from Github to BitBucket, but when I trying to commit files, it is much slower than Github.
fields.summary: Optimise network performance in China

fields.description: Under /username/repo/admin/issues/notifications, we should make it possible to send notifications for all issue changes, not just when new issues are raised.
fields.summary: Support sending notifications for all issue changes to custom configured emails (BB-3920)

fields.description:
The last seven days, five users have started following random projects of mine. All of these users:

* joined bitbucket 26 March 2012
* have usernames ending in 80
* have no repos, they are only following other projects
* seem to be following projects at random (such as projects called "test" with no commits)
* have a Website in their user settings

I suspect they are fishing for inbound links or inbound traffic.

No matter their intentions, they are adding noise without adding value to bitbucket. This should be addressed.

The user names of the users polluting my stream are: kellyo80, mariab80, henrya80, peterh80 and steven80.
fields.summary: Surge of spam users called <something>80

fields.description:
Hi

I tried to clone

hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/laczoka/grcrawler\\
running ssh hg@bitbucket.org "hg -R laczoka/grcrawler serve --stdio"\\
destination directory: grcrawler\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes

this is where it stopped and I had to hit ctrl-c.\\
http:// works, but password-only which is tedious

confirmed by alexstolz too.

thx
fields.summary: pubkey auth doesn't work for hg clone

fields.description:
The following commits were done by my jmellentine user, but show up as being committed by my jaredmellentine user.  The jaredmellentine user has no access to the private repositories for those commits and there is no trace of the jaredmellentine user on this laptop.  How is this even happening?

Is this just a bug or is it a security issue?

[[https://bitbucket.org/jmellentine/build/changeset/a21987c971c7|a21987c971c7]]

[[https://bitbucket.org/jmellentine/build/changeset/ecb3748fa2e1|ecb3748fa2e1]]

[[https://bitbucket.org/jmellentine/build/changeset/b49f6d595b00|b49f6d595b00]]

[[https://bitbucket.org/jmellentine/app/changeset/86108f811be7|86108f811be7]]
fields.summary: Commits listed under wrong user

fields.description: I have 3 private repos, and I (the account owner) am the only one with access to any of them.  I'm on the free 5 user plan.  On the Plans and billing page, it says "2 / 5 private users".  No users are listed under "Access via groups", and only I am listed under "Direct access".  This would lead me to believe that the count should be 1/5.  One of the private repos is a username.bitbucket.org repo.  If that's why it's 2/5 (because public web access is counted as a user), it would be useful if that was indicated in some way on the page; perhaps a special entry in the "Direct access" section?
fields.summary: Incorrect private user count (BB-3918)

fields.description: Instead of just sending messages when new commits are pushed up.
fields.summary: HipChat broker should send messages for new PRs, issues, etc. (BB-3913)

fields.description: I think there's a problem with my repository at https://bitbucket.org/mattgwagner/mbaylist -- it's a HG problem (somehow I have revisions not in manifests?) , which is probably why it isn't able to be displayed on the web page. I think I can fix it locally, but I probably just need to delete the version on BitBucket and push a new copy.
fields.summary: Corrupt Repository

fields.description: There is simply no upload ("add download") button (see attached screenshot) that appears. Assuming this to be a JS/CSS error in layout - or is IE7 not supported?
fields.summary: IE 7 does not allow you to upload a file to downloads section

fields.description:
Hi, since this afternoon I started getting a message that reads "abort: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error" when pushing changes the bitbucket. I recently merged two branches, so it might have something to do with that.

Could you please advise which steps I should take to give extra feedback?
fields.summary: abort: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error

fields.description:
I checked the server response for my subdirectory http://wolfmanx.bitbucket.org/ws-vacation and saw that links without a trailing slash do not get a 301 redirect from nginx.

http://wolfmanx.bitbucket.org/ws-vacation should get a 301 redirect to http://wolfmanx.bitbucket.org/ws-vacation/, so that the browser knows how to construct relative links correctly.

But I can live with my workaround (see anonymous post at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing+a+Website+on+bitbucket)
fields.summary: username.bitbucket.org lacks proper redirect for subdirectories (BB-3910)

fields.description: I keep getting notifications that I've been granted permission to different repos, even though I have removed the checkmark that says e-mail notifications.
fields.summary: I get e-mail notifications even though I've turned them off

fields.description:
Hi there,

Just found a problem when I delete the previous account, and then I set up a new account with the same email address, it gives an error that the email has been occupied, but it is deleted though. So I wonder if you forgot to de-associate the email address when the previous account deleted?

Thanks,\\
William
fields.summary: one email account can not be register again when delete the previous account

fields.description:
I am trying to synchronise my repos using tortoise hg on mercurial but i keep on getting the following error.

ealm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: bobchege\\
searching for changes\\
abort: Permission denied: /home/chege/workspace/Eclipse/gradebookv1/.hg/store/data/scripts/gradebookv1__loaddata/parents__portal.sql.i\\
[command returned code 255 Mon Apr  2 23:33:20 2012]\\
gradebookv1%

This is inspite the fact that I am sure that my login credentials are correct. What could be the problem?
fields.summary: I cannot ba able to sychronise repos due to permission denied error

fields.description:
Hi,

https://bitbucket.org/richs80 and https://bitbucket.org/ericar80 seem to follow repositories randomly.  That might be a violation of ToS 3.12.
fields.summary: Users following repositories randomly (BB-3915)

fields.description:
"git -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin\\
fatal: https://veedfj@bitbucket.org/veedfj/it-ssns.git/info/refs not found: did you run git update-server-info on the server?\\
Completed with errors, see above"

I can not push, pull, checkout or rebase because of the above. Any tips appreciated. I have never seen this error before and don't get it at all.
fields.summary: Did you run update-server-info on the server?

fields.description:
When I created a issue just now, I forgot to set the "Assign to" and "Component" part, then after I clicked the "Report issue", it took a long time to load the new page and finally failed. After I enter my homepage, I' ve found that there are lots of status for my creation of that issue, like "You are no longer following this issue.", "You are now following this issue.", on and on. And what's more, I can never open that issue because when I do this, the page crashed.\\
Wish this can be solved.
fields.summary: A Bug For Create Issue

fields.description:
When I created a issue just now, I forgot to set the "Assign to" and "Component" part, then after I clicked the "Report issue", it took a long time to load the new page and finally failed. After I enter my homepage, I' ve found that there are lots of status for my creation of that issue, like "You are no longer following this issue.", "You are now following this issue.", on and on. And what's more, I can never open that issue because when I do this, the page crashed.\\
Wish this can be solved.
fields.summary: A Bug For Create Issue (BB-4015)

fields.description: Given that this is a Python website, I assume you use Pygments for syntax highlighting? There is now a lexer for the Elixir programming language in Pygments itself. I'd be awesome to have support for it. :)
fields.summary: Highlighting for Elixir (BB-3907)

fields.description:
Hi Bitbucket devs

https://bitbucket.org/jacmoe/ogitor/wiki is broken by a user adding a page with the following name:\\
https://bitbucket.org/jacmoe/ogitor/wiki/New_Editor_/_Property_System

The problem is that this name is invalid - at least on a Windows file system, so when he pulls he can't update.

Could you catch that in the page logic code?\\
That would be great.

Thanks. :)

Jacob
fields.summary: Invalid wiki page name destroys repository (BB-3906)

fields.description: both me and rschwers are unable to clone over https on the Northeastern 129.10._._. it works fine from 155.33._._ (also northeastern)
fields.summary: Unable to clone from 129.10.*.*

fields.description: When I tried to spoon (gentle as advised), my chopstick broke.
fields.summary: Spooning incompatible with chopsticks

fields.description: Kinda following up BCLOUD-2323, how about tags to organize projects?. This could also help enrich the repository search page ( https://bitbucket.org/repo/all?name= )
fields.summary: Tags for project categorizing/organization (BB-3904)

fields.description: It would be nice to see support for the LargeFiles extension with Mercurial 2.1+, even if it is only for paid plans
fields.summary: Mercurial - LargeFiles support (BB-3903)

fields.description: I have found someone in my access list I did not add to the list and no one has admin on my repository... I do not understand how this happened. I just noticed it was authed for read access to my private repo
fields.summary: People I never added to Access list

fields.description: I think showing the tags and branches in commit view should either be optional, or should be handled differently so they don't obscure the message or hash.
fields.summary: Commit view obscured when there are many tags/branches

fields.description:
I have 2 accounts registered with 2 different usernames but samen e-mail account for administration reasons. I have 2 different generated SSH keys and assigned them to the 2 accounts.

I made an inital commit with user A on system A (git config is set up for user A)\\
And worked on a different system B (different git config for user B). When I commit on system B and push it to Bitbucket it will show up with the wrong username (which is A) in Bitubucket. When I do a git log on system B it says it is commited under user B, but on Bitbucket it is commited under user A.

This is probably due to the same e-mail adress? I guess the committer is uniquely identified by the e-mail adress? Which is wrong I guess... It should be recognized by the SSH key or just simply used from the "user.name" setting?
fields.summary: Wrong commit user

fields.description:
This is not how tags should look in Mercurial:

https://bitbucket.org/mirror/django/src/7af63d65cede/django/tags/releases

This is much better:

https://bitbucket.org/django/django/

I suggest dropping the Bitbucket Django mirror and let the Django project maintain its own mirror.
fields.summary: Django mirror is a bad conversion (BB-3900)

fields.description:
Edit buttons in issues are not working (when you click, the page appears to reload, but no edit is triggered).\\
Also, when commenting a closing issue, the buttons I once saw, e.g. to link comment to a changeset, are no more shown over the textarea.
fields.summary: Edit buttons in issues are not working, editor functionalities missing

fields.description: Like the same issue tracker setting.
fields.summary: Support sending all PR notifications to a specific email address (BB-3897)
Can't clone - Permission Denied (publickey)

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to set up a login and password which has read-only access to a repository without creating a new Bitbucket user.

The details would be given to clients that require our latest code changes, but I don't want them to have access to the Bitbucket website.

The username would be unique to a repository, so for example I could add username=Anonymous to two of my repositories, each having whatever password I choose. It wouldn't be a real Bitbucket user account.
fields.summary: Shared read-only access to a private repository.

fields.description: If a wiki page is in a subdirectory, the {{{<<toc>>}}} directive is broken, all links points to the wrong site. See for example https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/wiki/developers/MacOSX
fields.summary: Toc directive broken if wiki page in subdirectory

fields.description: Please improve the default markdown css style, especially the h heading they are too dim and not standing out.
fields.summary: markdown default css style

fields.description: I don't like the fact that it sends them an email every time I revoke access to a developer to a repository. I would much rather have the option to choose to revoke silently. I have had developers write me in a panic thinking they were fired, and in the case of really firing someone I would rather be able to revoke their access silently and then have the conversation with them in a proper way.
fields.summary: Make notifications of revoked access optional (BB-3892)

fields.description:
I'm behind a corporate firewall which has port 22 blocked. I'm able to push/pull from my bitbucket repos using https, but its a real pain having to enter my password each time.

The way github addressed this was superb. They set up an ssh.github.com server which listens on port 443 and sets up the connection accordingly so that I can just enter

{{{\\
Host github.com\\
User yeosuanaik@gmail.com\\
Port 443\\
Hostname ssh.github.com\\
}}}

into my .ssh/config and it just works. Could bitbucket please do something similar? I'm sure many would appreciate it.
fields.summary: Stand up an SSH redirect server for bitbucket.org (BB-3714)

fields.description:
This is (related to) a general problem with watching/following on a DVCS repository hub, e.g. http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=3640856 but whereas that is about GitHub, my issue is with bitbucket.

I'd like to know about updates to certain projects but if they are "well known" enough, just the activity of people following (and in many cases un-following when they see how many updates they get from people following) is enough to nearly drive all the other entries out of my newsfeed.

The best (worst?) example of this is https://bitbucket.org/BruceEckel/python-3-patterns-idioms (currently 627 followers now that I have stopped) - the repo has had no activity other that follow/un-follow in almost three years, but still has lots of people following it.  Solution here is easy, just un-follow, since likelihood of actual updates is epsilon.  But for another popular project https://bitbucket.org/christianspecht/bitbucket-backup (with only 37 followers at the moment) there is nearly as much follow/un-follow activity but there are actually active developers working on the project, so un-following is not really an ideal solution.

Reporting on repo activity can be noisy enough that a "bookmark" rather than watch/follow may be desirable for some projects, but at least that is real activity (and the problem reported by Paul Asmuth for GitHub) - the problem is worse for bitbucket because this can happen even without any real activity.
fields.summary: changes in users following a project should not be reported in Newsfeed (BB-3891)

fields.description:
Bitbucket's issue tracker defaults to "major" and there is nothing between "major" and "minor", both of which have connotation of either elevated or reduced importance.

I have gone to great lengths to teach PMs that not every issue is major/critical.  Most issues deserve a priority something like "normal", so that elevated priorities like "major" or "critical" actually have some meaning.

I propose that a new status/priority of "normal" be added in the middle and that this become the default for all issues.

Thanks!\\
-JS
fields.summary: Add "normal" priority for issues (BB-3890)
When multiple accounts share the same unvalidated email address you can no longer access some of them via the API (BB-3886)
nagim20062006@yahoo.com

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/westhomas/deployhq-bitbucket-broker
fields.summary: Make this DeployHQ service broker availabe on Bitbucket (BB-3885)
Sort by priority should be highest first (BB-3880)

fields.description:
Via a support request:\\
{{{\\
Could you add a function to the advanced query that allows the user to\\
search a date range within which a ticket was resolved? For example, I\\
want to know which tickets were resolved between March 18 and 25 but I\\
can't see that unless I go into each ticket individually.\\
}}}
fields.summary: Allow searching issues between a date range (BB-3859)

fields.description: I recently deleted one of my mercurial repos, libircserver.  I then proceeded to re-create it as a git repo.  Now my repo list (https://bitbucket.org/repo/mine) still says that libircserver is a mercurial repo, when it's a git repo.
fields.summary: My repo list still thinks one of my repos is mercurial
